channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7482] Port HBASE-7442 HBase remote CopyTable not working when security enabled to trunk
item.description:
Excerpt about the choice of solution from :

The first option was actually quite messy to implement. clusterId and conf are fixed in HBaseClient when it's created and cached by SecureRpcEngine, so to implement the fix here I would have had to pass the different cluster confs up through HConnectionManager and HBaseRPC in order to override the clusterId in SecureClient#SecureConnection.

I've gone with the second option of creating and caching different SecureClients for the local and remote clusters in SecureRpcEngine - keyed off of the clusterId instead of the default SocketFactory. I think this is a cleaner solution.
item.summary: Port HBASE-7442 HBase remote CopyTable not working when security enabled to trunk

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Knocking down to major. No assignee.
The removal of ClientCache in HBASE-7460 should address the invalid Configuration/cluster ID used for a client in this case. All that remains is porting the TableMapReduceUtil bit.

James, I have a patch for this I can post – it's just the TableMapReduceUtil change from HBASE-7442. But I don't have 2 secure clusters setup for easy testing. Do you have test clusters where you can confirm the fix?

Hi Gary. Yes, I have 2 secure clusters which I setup for HBASE-7442. I've been testing a patch this afternoon and had to make an additional change to HConnectionImplementation to get it to work. I'll attach it for review.

In addition to the TableMapReduceUtil change, 'hbase.cluster.id' has to be reset in HConnectionImplementation to ensure that it's HBaseClient instance has the correct 'clusterId' set and therefore the correct token is selected when setting up the Connection.

against trunk revision .

Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

Passing the cluster ID through Configuration was originally a hack to avoid more invasive changes to ClientCache and the RPC engine layers that would have been required to directly represent cluster ID.

Now that we've already undertaking the removal of ClientCache and refactoring of RPC engines in 0.95/trunk, I think we're better off removing the Configuration pass-through completely.

Here's a modified patch that removes the mucking with Configuration and just passes through cluster ID as an honest-to-goodness parameter. I think this winds up being cleaner.

James, let me know your thoughts or if you can picture situations this might break.

Ran the full test suite for the v2 patch. The only failure was:

Results :



Failed tests:   queueFailover(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.TestReplicationQueueFailoverCompressed): Waited too much time for queueFailover replication. Waited 12273ms.



Tests run: 1461, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 13

+1

It's better not having to muck around with the configuration. V2 patch looks good and copytable works on my secure clusters.
Ted Yu any chance of a quick review, since you opened the original issue?

Patch looks good.


+  public static final String CLUSTER_ID_DEFAULT = "default";

nit: should we put 'cluster' in the default value ?

The default value ("default"), I just took from what was currently used as a string literal around the code and pulled it up into a constant. I could change it to "default-cluster". I don't think that will break anything.
Attaching a new patch for HadoopQA. Only change is replacing the default cluster ID ("default") with "default-cluster".
